column3: str
Thancred wishes to have a word with the hero of the hour.
Speak with Alisaie in the Crystarium.
Speak with Alisaie.
Speak with the manager of suites in the Pendants.

It was pure luck that we managed to hold the Eulmorans at bay long enough for you to succeed─but we have earned some good fortune. And while it is plain we've not seen the last of General Ran'jit, I for one am glad to delay our reckoning with him awhile longer.
It seems I was wrong about your friend. Had Feo Ul not stepped in, you'd be frolicking with the faeries by now.
I'm going to train harder. Having seen what you've achieved, it's the least I can do.
Though the battle is over, the war is far from won. Let us fix our gaze upon the road ahead.
I knew you could do it. And not only because of your blessing. You have a strength all your own, and it has seen us through many a trial.
With the Warden defeated, I believe our work here is done. It is time we were going─<Emphasis>together</Emphasis>, needless to say.
...To the bitter end─the fate of our two worlds being at stake, and all that.
Now then, I suggest we hurry back to the Crystarium. Much and more may have happened while we were frolicking with the fae folk.
That Ran'jit elected to pursue us makes me hopeful the city was spared Eulmore's attentions, but I would sooner see for myself.
Besides, I believe I speak for us all when I say that I've had a bellyful of Il Mheg. Let us away before the faeries think to play with us again.
I see nothing out of the ordinary.
Though we've spent most of our time on the road, Minfilia and I actually have apartments here. Perhaps now we may finally make use of them.
All seems well, thank goodness...
The city appeareth unchanged from when last I visited. There is the selfsame comforting hum of activity in the air.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? I...I was not expecting you so soon.
Glad though I am to see you, I daresay you are missed by your comrades. Mayhap you should rejoin them first.
Finding common ground with an Ascian... My entire being rebels at the very notion.
He appears to be gone, but I won't be lowering my guard just yet.
So that was an Ascian... Thancred told me about them.
That an Ascian of Emet-Selch's standing should willingly reveal himself unto us─and at this of all junctures─is...most interesting.
<Emphasis>Cooperation</Emphasis>? He can't be serious...can he?
Well, we've certainly been given much to ponder, but first things first: we should report to the Exarch.
You can run along, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. We're perfectly capable of handling this little task.
In light of your recent exertions, I'd say you've earned a rest.
Go on, take yourself off to bed. We'll see you later, refreshed and ready for more.
That your safe and triumphant return should be spoiled by an uninvited guest...
But let us not dwell on it here and now. I will have the details of your mission from the others. You, meanwhile, should get some rest.
Ah, welcome back, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. We've been expecting you.
You will find refreshments laid out in your quarters. We hope they are to your liking.
Will you be retiring now?
Retire to your quarters?
Very good, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. I bid you a pleasant evening.
